name: Quran.com Frontend (Next.js)

alignment.comment: Quran.com delivers open access to the Qur'an globally, perfectly aligned with MOSF's mission of open Islamic knowledge.

openness.comment: No LICENSE file is present. Until a permissive license (MIT/BSD/Apache) is added, the repository cannot be considered open source in legal terms.

liveness.comment: Ongoing commits, releases, and active issue triage through 2025.

value.comment: Strong technical architecture with Next.js, Storybook, testing, and localization. Excellent educational reference.

docs.comment: Clear setup and contribution documentation; could expand accessibility and RTL guidance.

community.comment: Healthy contributor culture with Discord, issue templates, and contribution guides.

ethics.comment: Purely faith-aligned mission serving global Qur'an accessibility.

summary: The official Quran.com frontend is one of the most impactful Muslim-led open web projects, demonstrating technical excellence and community stewardship. However, the absence of a clear open-source license prevents it from achieving 'Model Repository' status.
narrative: Built with Next.js and TypeScript, the Quran.com frontend powers one of the internet's most visited Qur'an platforms, offering translations, tafsÄ«r access, and a smooth multilingual experience.
Its engineering quality, modular design system, Storybook integration, and CI pipelines, shows maturity and reliability seldom matched in religious open technology projects.
The primary limitation is the lack of an explicit license file, which restricts derivative educational or collaborative reuse despite otherwise exemplary openness.
recommendations: Add an explicit LICENSE file (MIT, BSD, or Apache) to legally open the source.
Publish an accessibility checklist for screen readers, keyboard navigation, and color contrast.
Maintain a lightweight public roadmap or release changelog.
